intellimate.izou.events

Class LocalEventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • intellimate.izou.events.LocalEventManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class LocalEventManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, Identifiable
    This class is used to manage local events.

    • Method Detail

      • registerCaller

        public java.util.Optional<LocalEventManager.EventCaller> registerCaller(Identification identification)
                                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Registers with the EventManager to fire an event. Note: the same Event can be fired from multiple sources. Method is thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        identification - the Identification of the the instance
        Returns:
        an Optional, empty if already registered
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • unregisterCaller

        public void unregisterCaller(Identification identification)
        Unregister with the EventManager. Method is thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        identification - the Identification of the the instance

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getEvents

        public java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Event> getEvents()
        returns the BlockingQueue containing the events.
        Returns:
        an instance of BlockingQueue

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Should stop the EventManager. The method run() is a while-loop that repeats itself as long as a variable isn't true. This sets the variable true but does NOT interrupt the execution! If its not processing, it is waiting for an event, so this Thread still may not stop without interruption.

      • getID

        public java.lang.String getID()
        An ID must always be unique. A Class like Activator or OutputPlugin can just provide their .class.getCanonicalName() If you have to implement this interface multiple times, just concatenate unique Strings to .class.getCanonicalName()
        Specified by:
        getID in interface Identifiable
        Returns:
        A String containing an ID
